id.docs:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: The ID to use for code generation, and for reference by dependent components.

*See also: [BLE Client](https://esphome.io/components/ble_client.html#configuration-variables)*

mac_address.docs:
**MAC Address**: The MAC address of the BLE device to connect to.

*See also: [BLE Client](https://esphome.io/components/ble_client.html#configuration-variables)*

auto_connect.docs:
**boolean**: If true the device will be automatically connected when found by the [ESP32 Bluetooth Low Energy Tracker Hub](https://esphome.io/components/esp32_ble_tracker.html). Defaults to true.

*See also: [BLE Client](https://esphome.io/components/ble_client.html#configuration-variables)*

on_connect.docs:
**[Automation](https://esphome.io/automations/index.html#automation)**: An automation to perform when the client connects to a device. See [on_connect](https://esphome.io/components/ble_client.html#ble-client-on-connect).

*See also: [BLE Client](https://esphome.io/components/ble_client.html#configuration-variables)*

on_disconnect.docs:
**[Automation](https://esphome.io/automations/index.html#automation)**: An automation to perform when the client disconnects from a device. See [on_disconnect](https://esphome.io/components/ble_client.html#ble-client-on-disconnect).

*See also: [BLE Client](https://esphome.io/components/ble_client.html#configuration-variables)*

on_passkey_request.docs:
**[Automation](https://esphome.io/automations/index.html#automation)**: An automation to enter the passkey required by the other BLE device. See [on_passkey_request](https://esphome.io/components/ble_client.html#ble-client-on-passkey-request).

*See also: [BLE Client](https://esphome.io/components/ble_client.html#configuration-variables)*

on_passkey_notification.docs:
**[Automation](https://esphome.io/automations/index.html#automation)**: An automation to display the passkey to the user. See [on_passkey_notification](https://esphome.io/components/ble_client.html#ble-client-on-passkey-notification).

*See also: [BLE Client](https://esphome.io/components/ble_client.html#configuration-variables)*

on_numeric_comparison_request.docs:
**[Automation](https://esphome.io/automations/index.html#automation)**: An automation to compare the passkeys shown on the two BLE devices. See [on_numeric_comparison_request](https://esphome.io/components/ble_client.html#ble-client-on-numeric-comparison-request).

*See also: [BLE Client](https://esphome.io/components/ble_client.html#configuration-variables)*

ble_client_id.docs:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: ID of the associated BLE client.

*See also: [BLE Client Text Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/text_sensor/ble_client.html#configuration-variables)*

disconnect.docs:
This action disconnects a device that was connected with the `ble_client.connect` action. Execution of the automation block sequence resumes after the disconnect has completed.

*See also: [`ble_client.disconnect` Action](https://esphome.io/components/ble_client.html#ble-client-disconnect-action)*

connect.docs:
This action is useful only for devices with `auto_connect: false` and allows a connection to be made from within an automation. Once connected other actions like `ble_write` can be used. This is useful where a BLE server needs only to be interacted with occasionally, and thus does not need a constant connection held.

*See also: [`ble_client.connect` Action](https://esphome.io/components/ble_client.html#ble-client-connect-action)*

id.docs:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: ID of the associated BLE client.

*See also: [BLE Client](https://esphome.io/components/ble_client.html#ble-client-ble-write-action)*

service_uuid.docs:
**UUID**: UUID of the service to write to.

*See also: [BLE Client](https://esphome.io/components/ble_client.html#ble-client-ble-write-action)*

characteristic_uuid.docs:
**UUID**: UUID of the service’s characteristic to write to.

*See also: [BLE Client](https://esphome.io/components/ble_client.html#ble-client-ble-write-action)*

value.docs:
**Array of bytes or [lambda](https://esphome.io/automations/templates.html#config-lambda)**: The value to be written.

*See also: [BLE Client](https://esphome.io/components/ble_client.html#ble-client-ble-write-action)*

ble_write.docs:
This action triggers a write to a specified BLE characteristic. The write is attempted in a best-effort fashion and will only succeed if the `ble_client`’s  connection has been established and the peripheral exposes the expected BLE service and characteristic. Execution of the automation block sequence resumes after the write has completed. A write failure will *not* stop execution of succeeding actions (this allows a disconnect to be executed, for example.)

*See also: [`ble_client.ble_write` Action](https://esphome.io/components/ble_client.html#ble-client-ble-write-action)*

id.docs:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: ID of the associated BLE client.

*See also: [BLE Client](https://esphome.io/components/ble_client.html#ble-client-numeric-comparison-reply-action)*

accept.docs:
**boolean**: Should be `true` if the passkeys displayed on both BLE devices are matching.

*See also: [BLE Client](https://esphome.io/components/ble_client.html#ble-client-numeric-comparison-reply-action)*

numeric_comparison_reply.docs:
This action triggers an authentication attempt after a numeric comparison.

*See also: [`ble_client.numeric_comparison_reply` Action](https://esphome.io/components/ble_client.html#ble-client-numeric-comparison-reply-action)*

id.docs:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: ID of the associated BLE client.

*See also: [BLE Client](https://esphome.io/components/ble_client.html#ble-client-passkey-reply-action)*

passkey_reply.docs:
This action triggers an authentication attempt using the specified `passkey`.

*See also: [`ble_client.passkey_reply` Action](https://esphome.io/components/ble_client.html#ble-client-passkey-reply-action)*

id.docs:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: ID of the associated BLE client.

*See also: [BLE Client](https://esphome.io/components/ble_client.html#ble-client-remove-bond-action)*

remove_bond.docs:
This action removes a device from the security database and manages unpairing.

*See also: [`ble_client.remove_bond` Action](https://esphome.io/components/ble_client.html#ble-client-remove-bond-action)*
